reviews.review_text: Absolute crap, you have to buy the damned campaign, the graphics suck, tutorial is vague and unhelpful and part of the campaign you have to buy, controls are clunky, do not buy.

Uhm.... It seems like it might have potential, but you have to connect to a server to play single-player. Heck, you have to connect to a server to even play the tutorial. And the devs don't seem to understand why this makes people upset. - Edit - they've updated this, so you no longer need to be online. But it's still not living up to it's potential.

APOX isn't given as much credit as it ought to have. Despite its somewhat dated graphics, it's quite a fun RTS with several unique components. Games are quick and usually full of action. I'm not an RTS kind of guy, and I'm typically really bad at them, but this was one I could get into for a little while.
A great and interesting concept utterly wasted by its poor execution. This could have been so good. Too bad it isn't,
